------------------Module 1:Practicals------------------

1. Write a program that compares two strings and checks for substring presence.

import java.util.Scanner;
public class sample {
 	public static void main(String[] args) {
 		System.out.println("Name: Maanya Harish Mendon");
 		System.out.println("Roll no: 90");
 		System.out.println("Div: B");
 		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
 		Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
 		System.out.println("Enter First String: ");
 		String str1=sc.nextLine();
 		System.out.println("Enter Second String: ");
 		String str2=sc.nextLine();
 		if(str1.equals(str2)) {
 			System.out.println("Both Strings are equal");}
 		else {System.out.println("Strings are not equal");}
 		if(str1.contains(str2)) {
 			System.out.println("\" "+ str2 + "\" is a substring of \" "+ str1+"\" ");}
 		else if(str2.contains(str1)) {
 			System.out.println("\" "+ str1 + "\" is a substring of \" "+ str2+"\" ");}
 		else {
 			System.out.println("No Substring relation found between two strings.");}
 		sc.close();}}


2. Program to encode characters to their Unicode representations and decode them back.

import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
import java.util.Scanner;
public class sample {
 	public static void main(String[] args) {
 		System.out.println("Name: Maanya Harish Mendon");
 		System.out.println("Roll no: 90");
 		System.out.println("Div: B");
       Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
       System.out.print("Enter a string: ");
       String inputString = scanner.nextLine();
       System.out.println("\nUnicode code points for the input string:");
       for (int i = 0; i < inputString.length(); i++) {
           int codePoint = inputString.codePointAt(i);
           System.out.printf("Character: "+inputString.charAt(i)+" Code point: "+ codePoint+"\n");
       }
       byte[] utf8Bytes = inputString.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
       System.out.println("\nString in UTF-8 byte encoding:");
       for (byte b : utf8Bytes) {
           System.out.printf("Byte:"+ b+"\n"); // Print each byte in hexadecimal format
       }
       String decodedString = new String(utf8Bytes, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
       System.out.println("\nDecoded string from UTF-8 bytes: " + decodedString);
       scanner.close();}}


Program 3 : Write a program that takes user input for multiple strings and appends them using StringBuilder.

import java.util.Scanner;
public class sample {
 	public static void main(String[] args) {
System.out.println("Name: Maanya Harish Mendon");
 		System.out.println("Roll no: 90");
 		System.out.println("Div: B");
   	Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
   	StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
   	System.out.println("Enter strings to concatenate (type 'exit' to stop):");
   	while (true) {
       	String input = scanner.nextLine();
       	if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("exit")){
           	break;}
       	result.append(input).append(" "); }
   	System.out.println("Concatenated result: " + result.toString().trim());
   	scanner.close(); }}

Program 4 : Write a program to split a paragraph into individual sentences

import java.util.Scanner;
public class sample {
 	public static void main(String[] args) {
 		System.out.println("Name: Maanya Harish Mendon");
 		System.out.println("Roll no: 90");
 		System.out.println("Div: B");
   	String paragraph = "This is the first sentence. Is this the second sentence? Yes! It is the third one.";
   	String[] sentences = paragraph.split("[.?!]");
   	for (int i = 0; i < sentences.length; i++) {
       	System.out.println(sentences[i].trim());
   	}
 	}
}

Program 5 : Write a program to convert a date object to a string in a specific format.

import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.Date;
public class sample {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
  	System.out.println("Name : Maanya Harish Mendon");
 	  	System.out.println("Roll No  : 90");
      // Create a Date object representing the current date and time
      Date currentDate = new Date();
      // Define the desired date format
      SimpleDateFormat formatter = new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MM/yyyy");
      // Convert the Date object into a formatted string
      String formattedDate = formatter.format(currentDate);
      // Display the formatted date string
      System.out.println("Current Date in formatted form: " + formattedDate);
  }
}


Program 6 : Write a program to insert a substring into a string at a specific position using StringBuilder.

import java.util.Scanner;
public class sample {
 	public static void main(String[] args) {
 		System.out.println("Name : Maanya Harish Mendon");
 	  	System.out.println("Roll No  : 90")
 		Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
 
      System.out.print("Enter the original string: ");
      String original = sc.nextLine()
System.out.print("Enter the substring to insert: ")
 String substring = sc.nextLine();
System.out.print("Enter the position to insert at : ");
      int position = sc.nextInt();
StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(original);
sb.insert(position, substring);
System.out.println("String after insertion: " + sb.toString());
      sc.close();}}


Program 7: Write a program to remove null values from an array of strings

 public class sample {
 	public static void main(String[] args) {
 	System.out.println("Name : Maanya Harish Mendon ");
 	  	System.out.println("Roll No  : 90");
   	// Initialize array with some null values
   	String[] strArray = {"apple", null, "banana", "cherry", null, "date"};
   	// Count non-null values to create a new array
   	int count = 0;
   	for (String s : strArray) {
       	if (s != null) {
           	count++;
       	}
   	}
   	// Create a new array to store non-null values
   	String[] resultArray = new String[count];
   	int index = 0;
   	// Copy non-null values into the new array
   	for (String s : strArray) {
       	if (s != null) {
           	resultArray[index++] = s;
       	}
   	}
   	// Print the result
   	System.out.print("Array after removing null values: ");
   	for (String s : resultArray) {
       	System.out.print(s + " ");
   	}
 	}
}

Program 8: Write a program to find all occurrences of a pattern in a string using Pattern and Matcher.

import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;
public class sample {
 	public static void main(String[] args) {
 		System.out.println("Name : Maanya Harish Mendon");
 		System.out.println("Roll No  : 90");
 		 Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
 	        // Input string
 	        System.out.print("Enter the main string: ");
 	        String inputString = sc.nextLine();
 	        // Input pattern
 	        System.out.print("Enter the pattern to find: ");
 	        String patternString = sc.nextLine();
 	        // Compile the pattern
 	        Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile(patternString);
 	        // Create matcher
 	        Matcher matcher = pattern.matcher(inputString);
 	        boolean found = false;
 	        System.out.println("\nOccurrences of pattern \"" + patternString + "\":");
 	        // Find and display all matches
 	        while (matcher.find()) {
 	            System.out.println("Found at index " + matcher.start() + " to " + matcher.end());
 	            found = true;
 	        }
 	        if (!found) {
 	            System.out.println("No occurrences found.");
 	        }
 	        sc.close();}}


Program 9: Write a program to count the number of vowels in a string using the Character class

import java.util.Scanner;
public class sample {
 		  public static boolean isVowel(char ch) {
 		        return (ch == 'a' || ch == 'e' || ch == 'i' || ch == 'o' || ch == 'u');
 		    }
 		    public static void main(String[] args) {
 		    	System.out.println("Name : Maanya Harish Mendon");
 				System.out.println("Roll No  : 90");
 
 		        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
 		        // Input string
 		        System.out.print("Enter a string: ");
 		        String input = sc.nextLine();
 		        // Convert to lowercase
 		        input = input.toLowerCase();
 		        int count = 0;
 		        // Loop through each character
 		        for (int i = 0; i < input.length(); i++) {
 		            char ch = input.charAt(i);
 		            if (Character.isLetter(ch) && isVowel(ch)) {
 		                count++;
 		            }
 		        }
 		        // Display result
 		        System.out.println("Number of vowels in the string: " + count);
 		        sc.close();
 
 
 	}
}


Program 10 : Write a program to check whether a given string is a palindrome or not by using

A.StringBuffer Class

import java.util.Scanner;
public class sample{
  public static void main(String[] args) {
  	System.out.println("Name : Maanya Harish Mendon");
 		System.out.println("Roll No  : 90");
 
      Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
      // Input string
      System.out.print("Enter a string: ");
      String input = sc.nextLine();
      // Create StringBuffer and reverse
      StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer(input);
      String reversed = sb.reverse().toString();
      // Compare ignoring case
      if (input.equalsIgnoreCase(reversed))
          System.out.println("The string is a palindrome.");
      else
          System.out.println("The string is not a palindrome.");
      sc.close();  }}

B.String Class

import java.util.Scanner;
public class sample{
public static void main(String[] args) {
 	 System.out.println("Name : Maanya Harish Mendon");
 	 System.out.println("Roll No  : 90");
   Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
   // Input string
   System.out.print("Enter a string: ");
   String input = sc.nextLine();
   // Reverse manually using String
   String reversed = "";
   for (int i = input.length() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
       reversed += input.charAt(i);
   }
   // Compare ignoring case
   if (input.equalsIgnoreCase(reversed))
       System.out.println("The string is a palindrome.");
   else
       System.out.println("The string is not a palindrome.");
   sc.close();}}



------------------Module 2: Practicals--------------------


Q1. Write a Java program to create List containing list of items of type String and use for- --each loop to print the items of the list.


To Create List of strings ,add multiple strings items and display each element.

import java.util.*;
public class Assignment{
public static void main(String args[]){
//Creating a List
System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
List<String> list=new ArrayList<String>();
//Adding elements in the List
list.add("Mango");
list.add("Apple");
list.add("Banana");
list.add("Grapes");
//Iterating the List element using for-each loop
for(String fruit:list)
System.out.println(fruit);
}
}


Q2. Write a Java program to create List containing list of items and use ListIterator interface to print items present in the list. Also print the list in reverse/ backward direction.

To write a Java program that demonstrates how to:
1. Create a List containing items (Strings).
2. Use the ListIterator interface to traverse the list in both forward and backward (reverse) directions.


import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ListIterator;
public class Assignment{
public static void main(String args[]){
//Creating a List
System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
List<Integer> numList = Arrays.asList(1,2,3,4,5);
ListIterator<Integer> numIterator = numList.listIterator();
System.out.println("Forward Direction Iteration:");
while (numIterator.hasNext()) {
System.out.println(numIterator.next());
}
System.out.println();
System.out.println("Backward Direction Iteration:");
while (numIterator.hasPrevious()) {
System.out.println(numIterator.previous());
}
}
}

 				Set Interface

Q3) WAP to create a Set containing a list of items of type String and print the items in the list using an iterator interface. Also print the list in reverse order.

1. Create a Set containing elements of type String.
2. Traverse and display the elements using the Iterator interface.
3. Display the elements in reverse order (using a suitable method, since Set does not support direct reverse traversal).


import java.util.*;
public class Assignment{
public static void main(String args[]){
System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
Set<String>languageSet = new HashSet<>();
languageSet.add("Python");
languageSet.add("Java");
languageSet.add("Node.js");
languageSet.add("Programming with C++");
System.out.println("Traversing in forward direction:");
Iterator<String>itr=languageSet.iterator();
// in the Set
while(itr.hasNext())
{
System.out.println(itr.next());
}
List<String> languageList=new ArrayList<>(languageSet);
Collections.reverse (languageList);
System.out.println("\n Traversing in reverse direction:");
for(String language: languageList)
{
System.out.println(language);
}
}}


Q4) WAP using set interface containing list of items and perform the following operations:
a) Add items in the set.
b) Insert items of one set into another set
c) Remove the items from the set.
d) Search the specified item in the set

import java.util.*;
public class Assignment{
public static void main(String args[]){
System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
int search_item=4;
Set<Integer> set1 = new HashSet<>();
// Add elements to the set1
set1.add(2);
set1.add(3);
set1.add(4);
set1.add(6);
System.out.println("Set1: "+ set1);
boolean result=set1.contains (search_item);
System.out.println("is the search item exist in set1 "+ result);
// remove the items form the set
//if the result value is true
if(result)
{
set1.remove(search_item);
}
System.out.println("After removing the search item display the set1"+set1);
//insert items of one set1 into another set2
Set<Integer> set2=new HashSet<>(set1);
Iterator<Integer>itr=set2.iterator();
System.out.println("Set2: regular Traversing");
while(itr.hasNext()) {
System.out.println(itr.next());
}
}
}


Q5) WAP using Map interface containing list of items having keys and associated values and perform the following operations.
a) Add items in the map
b) Remove Items in the map
c) Search specific key in the map
d) Get value of Specified key
e) Insert map elements of one map into another map
f) Print all keys and values pair of the map

import java.util.*;
import java.util.HashMap;
public class Assignment{
 	public static void main(String[] args) {
 		System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
 		System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
 		{
 			Map <Integer, String > studentRecords = new HashMap<>();
 			studentRecords.put(130, "Sandhya Santhosh");
 			studentRecords.put(133, "Sayyed Jishaan Imtiyaz");
 			studentRecords.put(134, "Shah Malav Chetan");
 			studentRecords.put(135, "Shaikh Afsha Ashraf");
 			studentRecords.put(136, "Shaikh Saud Yasin");
 			studentRecords.put(137, "Shaikh Souleh Mohammed Akram");
 			System.out.println("Initial Records of a group:");
 			System.out.println("Map: " + studentRecords);
 			boolean isRollNo136There = studentRecords.containsKey(136);
 			if (isRollNo136There)
 			{
 			studentRecords.remove(136);
 			}
 			System.out.println("\nAfter removal of roll no. 136:"+studentRecords);
 			System.out.println("\nDisplaying the record of roll no. 137:");
 			String studentName = studentRecords.get(137);
 			System.out.println(137 + " " + studentName);
 			Map<Integer, String> newStudentGroup = new TreeMap <>(studentRecords);
 			newStudentGroup.remove(133);
 			System.out.println("\nTraversing the map after removing roll no. 133 from newgroup:"+studentRecords);
 			for (Map.Entry<Integer,String> entry : newStudentGroup.entrySet())
 			System.out.println("Key = "+ entry.getKey() +", Value =" + entry.getValue());
 			}
 			}
 			}


Q6) WAP using Lambda Expression to print “Hello World”

interface Sayable{
 	public String say();
 	}
public class Assignment{
 	public static void main(String[] args) {
 		System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
 		System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
 		{
 			Sayable s=()->{
 				return"hello world";
 				};
 				System.out.println(s.say());
 				}}}


Q7) WAP using Lambda Expression with single parameter

interface Sayable1
{
public String say(String name);
}
public class Assignment
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
 	System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
 	System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
Sayable1 s1=(name)->{
return "Hello ,"+name;
};
System.out.println(s1.say("Single Parameter"));
}
}

Q8) WAP using Lambda Expression with multiple parameters to print addition of two numbers

interface Arithmetic
{
public int add(int a, int b);
}
public class Assignment
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
 	System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
 	System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
 	Arithmetic arth = (a, b) -> {
 		return a+b ;
 		};
 		int sumOfNumbers = arth.add(5,6);
 		System.out.println(sumOfNumbers);
 		}
 		}

Q9) WAP using Lambda Expression to calculate following:
a) Convert Fahrenheit to Celsius
b) Convert Kilometres to Metres


interface TemperatureInterface
{
public void fahrenheitToCelsius(double fahrenheit);
}
interface DistanceInterface
{
public void kilometersToMeters(double kilometers);
}
public class Assignment
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
 	System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
 	System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
 	TemperatureInterface temp = (fahrenheit) ->
 	{
 	System.out.println((fahrenheit - 32) * (5.0 / 9.0));
 	};
 	DistanceInterface dist = (kilometers) ->{
 	System.out.println(kilometers*1000);
 	};
 	temp.fahrenheitToCelsius(97.6);
 	dist.kilometersToMeters(6.3);
 	}}


Q10) WAP using Lambda Expression with or without return keyword.

interface Arithmetic2
{
public int add(int a,int b);
}
public class Assignment
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
 	System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
 	System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
 	Arithmetic2 arith2=(a,b)->{
 		return (a+b);
 		};
 		int sum=arith2.add(10,20);
 		System.out.println("sum of 2 nos"+sum);
 		Arithmetic2 arth = (a, b) -> a+b;
 		int sumOfNumbers = arth.add(5,6);
 		System.out.println(sumOfNumbers);
 		}}


Q11) WAP using Lambda Expression to concatenate two strings.

@FunctionalInterface
interface BuildString
{
public String concatenate(String str1, String str2);
}
public class Assignment
{
public static void main(String[] args)
{
 	System.out.println("Name : Maanya Mendon");
 	System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
 	BuildString string = (str1, str2) -> str1+str2;
 	String name = string.concatenate("xyz ","abc");
 	System.out.println(name);}}


---------------------Module 3: Practicals-------------------------

Add the external jars files to the created project
Right click on project name->properties-> java build path->libraries ->classpath->click on add external jar files

download the zipped file JAR FOR SPRING
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mRcXN1YerTX6YRyFhh5KrJ08ktiyO2Vg/view?usp=drive_link


Q1) Create a simple spring application to print Hello World.

Folder Structure
SpringHelloWorld
│
├── module3spring
│   ├── helloworld.java
│   └── App.java
│
├── config.xml(src>right click)
└── lib
    └── (Spring JAR files)

helloworld.java
package module3spring;
public class helloworld {
    public void display() {
        System.out.println("Maanya Mendon, Rollno:90");
        System.out.println("Hello World!");
    }
}

App.java
package module3spring;
import org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext;
import org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext;
public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        ApplicationContext context =
                new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext("config.xml");
        helloworld obj = (helloworld) context.getBean("hw");
        obj.display();
    }
}

config.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<beans 
    xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xsi:schemaLocation="
        http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans
        http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans.xsd">
    <bean id="hw" class="module3spring.helloworld" />
</beans>

Q2) Write a program to demonstrate dependency injection via setter method. (Bank Account Application).

Folder Structure
SpringDISetter
│
├── demo(package)
│   ├── Bank.java
│   ├── Account.java
│   └── App.java
│
├── config.xml(file)
└── lib
    └── (Spring JAR files)

Bank.java

package demo;
public class Bank {
    private String bankName;

    public String getBankName() {
        return bankName;
    }

    public void setBankName(String bankName) {
        this.bankName = bankName;
    }
}

Account.java

package demo;

public class Account {
    private int accNo;
    private String accName;
    private Bank bank;

    public int getAccNo() {
        return accNo;
    }

    public void setAccNo(int accNo) {
        this.accNo = accNo;
    }

    public String getAccName() {
        return accName;
    }

    public void setAccName(String accName) {
        this.accName = accName;
    }

    public Bank getBank() {
        return bank;
    }

    public void setBank(Bank bank) {
        this.bank = bank;
    }
}

App.java

package demo;

import org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext;
import org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {

        ApplicationContext context =
                new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext("config.xml");

        Account acc = (Account) context.getBean("Account");

        System.out.println("Account No = " + acc.getAccNo());
        System.out.println("Account Name = " + acc.getAccName());
        System.out.println("Bank Name = " + acc.getBank().getBankName());
    }
}

config.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<beans 
xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans" 
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" 
xsi:schemaLocation="
http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans
http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans.xsd">

    <bean id="Bank" class="demo.Bank">
        <property name="bankName" value="State Bank of India" />
    </bean>

    <bean id="Account" class="demo.Account">
        <property name="accNo" value="90" />
        <property name="accName" value="Maanya Mendon" />
        <property name="bank" ref="Bank" />
    </bean>
</beans>

Q3)  Write a program to demonstrate dependency injection via Constructor (Employee Application)(error in the output)


FullName.java

package demo;
public class FullName {
    private String firstname;
    private String lastname;
    public FullName(String firstname, String lastname) {
        this.firstname = firstname;
        this.lastname = lastname;
    }
    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "FullName [firstname=" + firstname + ", lastname=" + lastname + "]";
    }
}

Employee.java
package demo;
public class Employee {
    private int id;
    private FullName fullname;
    public Employee(int id, FullName fullname) {
        this.id = id;
        this.fullname = fullname;
    }
    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "Employee [id=" + id + ", fullname=" + fullname + "]";
    }
}

App.java
package demo;
import org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext;
import org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext;
public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        ApplicationContext context =
                new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext("config.xml");
        Employee emp = (Employee) context.getBean("Emp");
        System.out.println(emp);
    }
}

Config.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
       xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
       xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans
       http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans-3.0.xsd">
    <bean id="Emp" class="demo.Employee">
        <constructor-arg index="0" value="137"/>
        <constructor-arg index="1" ref="FullName1"/>
    </bean>
    <bean id="FullName1" class="demo.FullName">
        <constructor-arg index="0" value="Souleh"/>
        <constructor-arg index="1" value="Shaikh"/>
    </bean>
</beans>

----------------------------Module 4: Practicals----------------------------------------

Add the external jars files to the created project
Right click on project name->properties-> java build path->libraries ->classpath->click on add external jar files

download the zipped file 
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Lz_ZUnY4o1SlIOVrgSX1lloKbO_deZBS
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hGFuR7Sxj-BkgepfipSkidvjK9SWsy_N/view

1.Write a program to insert, update and delete records from the given table.(Movie Application)

Database:
create database college1;
use college1;
create table movies(
	id int,
    name varchar(255));
insert into movies values(1,"Maanya");
insert into movies values(2,"Mansi");

Package name: demo.spring.jdbc

Movie.java

package demo.spring.jdbc;

public class Movie {
    private int id;
    private String name;

    public Movie() {}

    public Movie(int id, String name) {
        this.id = id;
        this.name = name;
    }

    public int getId() {
        return id;
    }

    public void setId(int id) {
        this.id = id;
    }

    public String getName() {
        return name;
    }

    public void setName(String name) {
        this.name = name;
    }
}

MovieDAO.java

package demo.spring.jdbc;

import org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate;

public class MovieDAO {
    private JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate;

    public void setJdbcTemplate(JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate) {
        this.jdbcTemplate = jdbcTemplate;
    }

    public int insertMovie(Movie m1) {
        String query = "INSERT INTO movies VALUES (" + m1.getId() + ", '" + m1.getName() + "')";
        return jdbcTemplate.update(query);
    }

    public int deleteMovie(Movie m2) {
        String query = "DELETE FROM movies WHERE id = " + m2.getId();
        return jdbcTemplate.update(query);
    }

    public int updateMovie(Movie m3) {
        String query = "UPDATE movies SET name = '" + m3.getName() + "' WHERE id = " + m3.getId();
        return jdbcTemplate.update(query);
    }
}

App.java

package demo.spring.jdbc;

import org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext;
import org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {

        ApplicationContext context =
                new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext("config.xml");

        MovieDAO movieDAO = (MovieDAO) context.getBean("movieDAO");

        Movie m1 = new Movie(1, "Godzilla vs Kong");
        Movie m2 = new Movie(2, "Star Trek II");
        Movie m3 = new Movie(3, "Jumanji");

        System.out.println("Name: Maanya Mendon");
        System.out.println("Roll No: 90");

        System.out.println("Inserted: " + movieDAO.insertMovie(m1));
        System.out.println("Inserted: " + movieDAO.insertMovie(m2));
        System.out.println("Inserted: " + movieDAO.insertMovie(m3));

        System.out.println("Deleted: " + movieDAO.deleteMovie(m2));

        m3.setName("Zathura");
        System.out.println("Updated: " + movieDAO.updateMovie(m3));

        System.out.println("All operations completed successfully");
    }
}

config.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
       xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
       xsi:schemaLocation="
       http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans
       http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans.xsd">

    <bean id="ds" class="org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.DriverManagerDataSource">
        <property name="driverClassName" value="com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver"/>
        <property name="url" value="jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/college"/>
        <property name="username" value="root"/>
        <property name="password" value="NewPassword123!"/>
    </bean>

    <bean id="jdbcTemplate" class="org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate">
        <property name="dataSource" ref="ds"/>
    </bean>

    <bean id="movieDAO" class="demo.spring.jdbc.MovieDAO">
        <property name="jdbcTemplate" ref="jdbcTemplate"/>
    </bean>

</beans>

2.Write a program to demonstrate PreparedStatement in Spring JdbcTemplate (Employee Application)

Database:
CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS college;
USE college;

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS emp (
  id INT,
  name VARCHAR(30),
  email VARCHAR(50)
);

SELECT * FROM emp;

Package: demo.spring.jdbc.Assignment_9_2

Employee.java

package demo.spring.jdbc.Assignment_9_2;

public class Employee {

    private int id;
    private String ename;
    private String email;

    public Employee() {
        super();
    }

    public Employee(int id, String ename, String email) {
        this.id = id;
        this.ename = ename;
        this.email = email;
    }

    public int getId() {
        return id;
    }

    public void setId(int id) {
        this.id = id;
    }

    public String getEname() {
        return ename;
    }

    public void setEname(String ename) {
        this.ename = ename;
    }

    public String getEmail() {
        return email;
    }

    public void setEmail(String email) {
        this.email = email;
    }
}

Filename: EmployeeDAO.java

package demo.spring.jdbc.Assignment_9_2;

import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
import java.sql.SQLException;
import org.springframework.jdbc.core.*;
import org.springframework.dao.*;

public class EmployeeDAO {

    private JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate;

    public void setJdbcTemplate(JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate) {
        this.jdbcTemplate = jdbcTemplate;
    }

    public Boolean insEmp(final Employee e) {
        String query = "insert into emp values(?,?,?)";
        return jdbcTemplate.execute(query, new PreparedStatementCallback<Boolean>() {

            public Boolean doInPreparedStatement(PreparedStatement ps)
                    throws SQLException, DataAccessException {

                ps.setInt(1, e.getId());
                ps.setString(2, e.getEname());
                ps.setString(3, e.getEmail());
                return ps.executeUpdate() > 0;
            }
        });
    }
}

Filename: App.java
package demo.spring.jdbc.Assignment_9_2;

import org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext;
import org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {

        ApplicationContext con =
                new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext("config.xml");

        EmployeeDAO edao = (EmployeeDAO) con.getBean("empdao");

        Employee e = new Employee(3, "Maanya Mendon", "maanyamendon@gmail.com");
        

        System.out.println(edao.insEmp(e));
    }
}

Filename: config.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
       xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
       xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans
       http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans.xsd">

    <bean id="ds" class="org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.DriverManagerDataSource">
        <property name="driverClassName" value="com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver"/>

        <property name="url" value="jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/college"/>
        <property name="username" value="root"/>
        <property name="password" value="root"/>
    </bean>

    <bean id="jdbcTemplate" class="org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate">
        <property name="dataSource" ref="ds"/>
    </bean>

    <bean id="empdao" class="demo.spring.jdbc.Assignment_9_2.EmployeeDAO">
        <property name="jdbcTemplate" ref="jdbcTemplate"/>
    </bean>

</beans>

3 Write a program to to demonstrate ResultSetExtractor Interface (Employee Application)

Database Setup:
-- Create database
CREATE DATABASE Assignment9_DB;
USE Assignment9_DB;

-- Create Employee table
CREATE TABLE emp(
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    ename VARCHAR(30),
    email VARCHAR(50)
);

-- Insert sample data
INSERT INTO emp VALUES (1, 'Maanya', 'maanya@gmail.com');
INSERT INTO emp VALUES (2, 'Seema', 'seema@gmail.com');

1. Employee.java
package demo.spring.jdbc.Assignment_9_3;

public class Employee {
    private int id;
    private String ename;
    private String email;

    public Employee() { }

    public Employee(int id, String ename, String email) {
        this.id = id;
        this.ename = ename;
        this.email = email;
    }

    public int getId() { return id; }
    public void setId(int id) { this.id = id; }

    public String getEname() { return ename; }
    public void setEname(String ename) { this.ename = ename; }

    public String getEmail() { return email; }
    public void setEmail(String email) { this.email = email; }
}
2. EmployeeDAO.java
package demo.spring.jdbc.Assignment_9_3;

import java.sql.ResultSet;
import java.sql.SQLException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException;
import org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate;
import org.springframework.jdbc.core.ResultSetExtractor;

public class EmployeeDAO {

    private JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate;

    public JdbcTemplate getJdbcTemplate() { return jdbcTemplate; }
    public void setJdbcTemplate(JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate) { this.jdbcTemplate = jdbcTemplate; }

    public List<Employee> getAllEmployees() {
        String query = "SELECT * FROM emp";
        return jdbcTemplate.query(query, new ResultSetExtractor<List<Employee>>() {
            public List<Employee> extractData(ResultSet rs) throws SQLException, DataAccessException {
                List<Employee> employees = new ArrayList<>();
                while (rs.next()) {
                    Employee e = new Employee();
                    e.setId(rs.getInt(1));
                    e.setEname(rs.getString(2));
                    e.setEmail(rs.getString(3));
                    employees.add(e);
                }
                return employees;
            }
        });
    }
}
3. App.java
package demo.spring.jdbc.Assignment_9_3;

import java.util.List;
import org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext;
import org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        ApplicationContext con = new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext("config.xml");
        EmployeeDAO emp = (EmployeeDAO) con.getBean("empDAO");
        List<Employee> emplist1 = emp.getAllEmployees();

        System.out.println("ResultSetExtractor output:");
        for (Employee e : emplist1) {
            System.out.print(e.getId() + " ");
            System.out.print(e.getEname() + " ");
            System.out.print(e.getEmail());
            System.out.println();
        }
    }
}

config.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
       xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
       xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans
       http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans.xsd">

    <bean id="ds" class="org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.DriverManagerDataSource">
        <property name="driverClassName" value="com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver"/>
        <property name="url" value="jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/Assignment9_DB"/>
        <property name="username" value="root"/>
        <property name="password" value="root"/>
    </bean>

    <bean id="jdbcTemplate" class="org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate">
        <property name="dataSource" ref="ds"/>
    </bean>

    <bean id="empDAO" class="demo.spring.jdbc.Assignment_9_3.EmployeeDAO">
        <property name="jdbcTemplate" ref="jdbcTemplate"/>
    </bean>
</beans>

4 Write a program to demonstrate the RowMapper interface to fetch the records from the database. (Employee Application)

Database setup
CREATE DATABASE EmployeeDB;
USE EmployeeDB;

CREATE TABLE employee(
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(50)
);

INSERT INTO employee VALUES
(1, 'Maanya', 'maanya@gmail.com'),
(2, 'Seema', 'seema@gmail.com');

Select * from employee;

2. Employee.java:
package com.demo.jdbc;

public class Employee {
    private int id;
    private String name;
    private String email;

    public Employee() {}
    public Employee(int id, String name, String email) {
        this.id = id;
        this.name = name;
        this.email = email;
    }

    public int getId() { return id; }
    public void setId(int id) { this.id = id; }
    public String getName() { return name; }
    public void setName(String name) { this.name = name; }
    public String getEmail() { return email; }
    public void setEmail(String email) { this.email = email; }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "Employee [id=" + id + ", name=" + name + ", email=" + email + "]";
    }
}

3. applicationContext.xml:
<beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
       xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
       xsi:schemaLocation="
       http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans
       http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans.xsd">

    <bean id="dataSource" class="org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.DriverManagerDataSource">
        <property name="driverClassName" value="com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver"/>
        <property name="url" value="jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/EmployeeDB"/>
        <property name="username" value="root"/>
        <property name="password" value="your_password"/>
    </bean>

    <bean id="jdbcTemplate" class="org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate">
        <property name="dataSource" ref="dataSource"/>
    </bean>

    <bean id="employeeDAO" class="com.demo.jdbc.EmployeeDAO">
        <property name="jdbcTemplate" ref="jdbcTemplate"/>
    </bean>
</beans>

4. EmployeeDAO.java:
package com.demo.jdbc;

import java.sql.ResultSet;
import java.sql.SQLException;
import java.util.List;
import org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate;
import org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowMapper;

public class EmployeeDAO {
    private JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate;
    public void setJdbcTemplate(JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate) { this.jdbcTemplate = jdbcTemplate; }

    public List<Employee> getAllEmployees() {
        String query = "SELECT * FROM employee";
        return jdbcTemplate.query(query, new RowMapper<Employee>() {
            public Employee mapRow(ResultSet rs, int rowNum) throws SQLException {
                Employee e = new Employee();
                e.setId(rs.getInt("id"));
                e.setName(rs.getString("name"));
                e.setEmail(rs.getString("email"));
                return e;
            }
        });
    }
}

5. App.java:
package com.demo.jdbc;

import java.util.List;
import org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext;
import org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        ApplicationContext context = new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext("applicationContext.xml");
        EmployeeDAO dao = context.getBean("employeeDAO", EmployeeDAO.class);
        List<Employee> employees = dao.getAllEmployees();

        for(Employee e : employees) {
            System.out.println(e);
        }
    }
}

1 Write a program to create a simple Spring Boot application that prints a message.

https://start.spring.io/
2. 	Project-	Maven
	Language-	Java
	Spring Boot-	3.2.x (recommended)
	Group-	com.example
	Artifact-	demo
	Name-	demo
	Packaging	- Jar
	Java-	17
3. click generate
4. Open Eclipse
	Go to:
	File → Import → Maven → Existing Maven Projects
	Click Browse

	Select the extracted demo folder

	Click Finish

5. Open this file:
	src/main/java
	→ com.example.demo
	→ DemoApplication.java

6. replace code
package com.example.demo;

import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;

@SpringBootApplication
public class DemoApplication {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        SpringApplication.run(DemoApplication.class, args);

        System.out.println("Name: Maanya Mendon");
        System.out.println("Roll No: 90");
        System.out.println("Hello from Spring Boot Application!");
    }
}

2. Write a program to demonstrate RESTful Web Services with spring boot.(Product Application)

https://start.spring.io/
Project: Maven Project
      Language: Java
      Spring Boot: 3.x (latest stable)
      Project Metadata:
	Group: com.example
	Artifact: product
	Name: ProductApplication
      Packaging: Jar
      Java Version: 17 (or what your IDE supports)
      Dependencies: Add
	Spring Web
	(Optional: Spring Boot DevTools for auto-reload)
      Click Generate, download the zip, and extract it.
      Open it in IntelliJ IDEA or Eclipse.
. Open Eclipse
 	Go to:
 	File → Import → Maven → Existing Maven Projects
 	Click Browse

 	Select the extracted demo folder

 	Click Finish

3. Create your Java classes
inside src/main/java/com/example/product/

Product.java
package com.example.product;

public class Product {
    private Integer id;  // changed from int
    private String name;
    private double price;

    public Product() {}

    public Product(Integer id, String name, double price) {
        this.id = id;
        this.name = name;
        this.price = price;
    }

    public Integer getId() {
        return id;
    }

    public void setId(Integer id) {
        this.id = id;
    }

    // name & price getters/setters
    public String getName() { return name; }
    public void setName(String name) { this.name = name; }
    public double getPrice() { return price; }
    public void setPrice(double price) { this.price = price; }
}

ProductApplication.java
(default)

ProductController.java

package com.example.product;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;

@RestController
@RequestMapping("/products")
public class ProductController {

    // List to store products
    List<Product> products = new ArrayList<>();

    // Constructor to initialize some products
    public ProductController() {
        products.add(new Product(1, "Laptop", 50000));
        products.add(new Product(2, "Mobile", 20000));
    }

    // GET all products
    @GetMapping
    public List<Product> getAllProducts() {
        return products;
    }

    // POST add a new product
    @PostMapping
    public String addProduct(@RequestBody Product product) {
        products.add(product);
        return "Product added successfully";
    }

    // PUT update a product by id
    @PutMapping("/{id}")
    public String updateProduct(@PathVariable int id, @RequestBody Product product) {
        for (Product p : products) {
            if (p.getId() == id) {
                p.setName(product.getName());
                p.setPrice(product.getPrice());
                return "Product updated successfully";
            }
        }
        return "Product not found";
    }

    // DELETE a product by id
    @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
    public String deleteProduct(@PathVariable int id) {
        products.removeIf(p -> p.getId() == id);
        return "Product deleted successfully";
    }
}

Right-click → Run ProductApplication

open postman:
1. GET all products
Method: GET
URL: http://localhost:8080/products

2. POST (Add a new product)
Method: POST
URL: http://localhost:8080/products
Body → raw → JSON:
{
    "id": 3,
    "name": "Tablet",
    "price": 15000
}

3. PUT (Update a product)
Method: PUT
URL: http://localhost:8080/products/2
Body → raw → JSON:
{
    "name": "Smartphone",
    "price": 25000
}

4. DELETE (Delete a product)
Method: DELETE
URL: http://localhost:8080/products/1
Click Send → Response: "Product deleted successfully"

--------------------------Module 6: Practicals--------------------------------
Step 1: 
Go to Spring Initializr: https://start.spring.io/
Configure the project like this:
Project: Maven
Language: Java
Spring Boot: 3.x (latest 3.x is fine)
Group: com.hiberexample
Artifact: hibernatedemo
Packaging: Jar
Java: 17

Add Dependencies:
Spring Web
Spring Data JPA
MySQL Driver

Click GENERATE, it will download a zip file.
Unzip the file somewhere (e.g., C:\Projects\hibernatedemo)
Open Eclipse → File → Import → Maven → Existing Maven Project → Browse → Finish

Step 2: Database Setup (MySQL)

CREATE DATABASE college;
USE college;

CREATE TABLE employee (
    id BIGINT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    department VARCHAR(255),
    salary VARCHAR(255),
    PRIMARY KEY (id)
);

INSERT INTO employee (name, department, salary) VALUES
('Anita Verma', 'HR', '40000'),
('Amit Kumar', 'Finance', '55000'),
('Neha Singh', 'IT', '60000'),
('Suresh Patel', 'Admin', '35000');

Step 3: Configure application.properties

Location: src/main/resources/application.properties

spring.application.name=hibernatedemo
server.port=8081

spring.datasource.url=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/college
spring.datasource.username=root
spring.datasource.password=root

spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto=update
spring.jpa.show-sql=true
spring.jpa.properties.hibernate.dialect=org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLDialect

Step 4: Create Model Class (Employee.java)

Location: src/main/java/com/hiberexample/hibernatedemo/Employee.java

package com.hiberexample.hibernatedemo;

import jakarta.persistence.*;

@Entity
@Table(name = "employee")
public class Employee {

    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    private Long id;

    @Column(name = "name", nullable = false)
    private String name;

    @Column(name = "department")
    private String department;

    @Column(name = "salary")
    private String salary;

    // Getters and Setters
    public Long getId() { return id; }
    public void setId(Long id) { this.id = id; }

    public String getName() { return name; }
    public void setName(String name) { this.name = name; }

    public String getDepartment() { return department; }
    public void setDepartment(String department) { this.department = department; }

    public String getSalary() { return salary; }
    public void setSalary(String salary) { this.salary = salary; }
}

EmployeeRepository.java

package com.hiberexample.hibernatedemo;

import java.util.List;
import org.springframework.stereotype.Repository;
import jakarta.persistence.EntityManager;
import jakarta.persistence.PersistenceContext;
import jakarta.transaction.Transactional;

@Repository
@Transactional
public class EmployeeRepository {

    @PersistenceContext
    private EntityManager entityManager;

    public Employee save(Employee employee) {
        if (employee.getId() == null) {
            entityManager.persist(employee);
        } else {
            entityManager.merge(employee);
        }
        return employee;
    }

    public Employee findById(Long id) {
        return entityManager.find(Employee.class, id);
    }

    public List<Employee> findAll() {
        return entityManager.createQuery("FROM Employee", Employee.class).getResultList();
    }

    public void deleteById(Long id) {
        Employee employee = entityManager.find(Employee.class, id);
        if (employee != null) {
            entityManager.remove(employee);
        }
    }
}

EmployeeService.java

package com.hiberexample.hibernatedemo;

import java.util.List;
import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
import org.springframework.stereotype.Service;

@Service
public class EmployeeService {

    @Autowired
    private EmployeeRepository employeeRepository;

    public Employee save(Employee employee) {
        return employeeRepository.save(employee);
    }

    public Employee findById(Long id) {
        return employeeRepository.findById(id);
    }

    public List<Employee> findAll() {
        return employeeRepository.findAll();
    }

    public void deleteById(Long id) {
        employeeRepository.deleteById(id);
    }
}

EmployeeController.java

package com.hiberexample.hibernatedemo;

import java.util.List;
import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
import org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;

@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/employees")
public class EmployeeController {

    @Autowired
    private EmployeeService employeeService;

    // CREATE
    @PostMapping
    public ResponseEntity<Employee> saveEmployee(@RequestBody Employee employee) {
        return ResponseEntity.ok(employeeService.save(employee));
    }

    // READ by ID
    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    public ResponseEntity<Employee> getEmployeeById(@PathVariable Long id) {
        Employee employee = employeeService.findById(id);
        if (employee != null) return ResponseEntity.ok(employee);
        return ResponseEntity.notFound().build();
    }

    // READ all
    @GetMapping
    public ResponseEntity<List<Employee>> getAllEmployees() {
        return ResponseEntity.ok(employeeService.findAll());
    }

    // DELETE
    @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
    public ResponseEntity<Void> deleteEmployee(@PathVariable Long id) {
        employeeService.deleteById(id);
        return ResponseEntity.noContent().build();
    }
}

HibernatedemoApplication.java

package com.hiberexample.hibernatedemo;

import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;

@SpringBootApplication
public class HibernatedemoApplication {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        SpringApplication.run(HibernatedemoApplication.class, args);
    }
}

Step 9: Test in Browser/Postman

Make sure server is running on port 8081.
Check console: Started HibernatedemoApplication in X seconds

Open browser: http://localhost:8081/api/employees → you should see all employees (JSON).

Postman Testing:

GET All Employees:
GET http://localhost:8081/api/employees

GET Employee by ID:
GET http://localhost:8081/api/employees/1

Add Employee:
POST http://localhost:8081/api/employees
Body → raw → JSON:
